column4: Hi, My Intel video driver is gone... strange.  It has been working fine for 4 months.  How do I reinstall it.  The system was using the Intel driver that come with the gnome version.
is this the main ubuntu support channel?
Yes
can you help with a video driver issue?  I know re installing is kind a basic thing, but i am a newbie.
Well, go ahead and ask.
my video driver disappeared.  How do I re-insall it?  intel chip. on the mother board.
Sorry to see you lost your video. Might want to try sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
thanks. What will that command do?
It runs a little configuration program. Use the defaults, or try some options.
Please save a copy of your config file beforehand.
will it reload the driver?  because the driver is definatly not there right now.
Well it "should". If not, you're in for some more work, I guess.
LOL  ok.  you said to save the config file.  do you mean save it to another name?
Right, just copy it to your home directory or somewhere.
cp /etc/X11/xorg.conf ~/xorg.conf.backup
this is doing my key board.. I have no idea what my key board is.  do I really have to count the keys?.
The default should be OK (it's US keyboard by default). Are you in a US or English country?
can I stop this.  and go back to what it was.  all i need to do is install a video driver not change my whole system.
i am using a wireless keyboard with several special keys that work fine.  this will turn them off.
X is responsible for keyboard, mouse input as well as graphical output. It shouldn't have written anything if you're still in the middle of things. Just close out.
If you're current x config file works right with the wireless keyboard, you may have to bring those settings over to the new config file. Good luck.
http://www.ubuntugeek.com/ubuntu-tiphow-to-removeinstall-and-reconfigure-xorg-without-reinstalling-ubuntu.html You can do this from the command line (non-graphical).
There's a non-graphical terminal available at Ctrl+Alt+F1 where you can enter these commands.
